Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2012 01:00PM Bono0208 wrote: I received my result back and one lump was benign - fibroadenoma.  The other lump came back as inconclusive for a fibroadenoma or phyllodes tumor.  I was referred to a breast surgeon and need to have it removed.  I think it is just a pre-caution in case it turns out to be a phyllodes tumor...but I was hoping this whole ordeal would be over with.  Regardless I can rest a little easier until Monday.  They are scheduling this ASAP though which is the most concerning part.
Posts.Title: Breast Biopsy Tomorrow...very concerned Bono0208 Bono0208

Posts.Content: Bono0208 wrote: Hello everyone, I am new to this board but have been reading a lot of these boards in anticipation.  Everyone here seems very supportive and helpful. I am 27 years old and my husband noticed a lump on my breast a couple of weeks ago.  It feels a lot like a marble and is moveable.  I scheduled an appointment right away and the NP thought it might be a cyst and scheduled me for a mammogram and ultrasound.  I went to both and the Radiologist thought it could be a fibroadenoma but confirmed it wasn't fluid filled and was a solid round mass.  He also found a complex cyst, that I could not feel but the ultrasound detected.  I am scheduled for a biopsy and aspriation tomorrow and am extrememly stressed out by this whole experience.  Hoping for benign results. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast Biopsy Tomorrow...very concerned Bono0208 Bono0208

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2012 03:33PM Bono0208 wrote: Thanks Deanna for your reply.  It is listed as BIRADs 4. I don't know if it is A,B,or C though.
